mdRecord.dcterms:title: Turbine Factory, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Behrens, Peter (German architect, painter, and designer, 1868-1940) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The turbine hall for the AEG in Berlin-Moabit —on the corner of Hutten Street —of 1909 ...represented the culmination of his efforts to give architectural dignity to a workplace, similar to the achievement of [Frank Lloyd Wright] with the Larkin Building in Buffalo. Glass and iron took over a workshop of an industrial plant, with an enormous span (28.16 yd.; 25.6 m). - Udo Kultermann. Architecture in the 20th Century. p30-31. - http://www.greatbuildings.com/buildings/A._E._G._High_Tension_Fac.html [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
